description: A superb example of the two-tone Submariner Date featuring an excellent and unpolished case showing only light wear from use. The original black luminova dial and matching hands are in perfect condition, complemented by the original black bezel insert which remains exceptionally well preserved. The watch is fitted with its original 93253 Oyster bracelet with solid endlinks, showing extremely light stretch from use. Claspcode DE7. The set includes everything shown in the pictures, including the original purchase invoice. Freshly serviced by Rolex in 2024 (service invoice and card included) and in perfect working condition. A particularly attractive example of the classic 16613, combining originality, full documentation, and recent Rolex service — ready to wear and enjoy.

An exceptional and unworn example of the highly sought-after Rolex Cosmograph Daytona 116500LN with black dial. The watch retains several original factory stickers — on the clasp, the back of the case, and one on the lower crown guard — confirming its untouched condition. Featuring the iconic black ceramic Cerachrom bezel and the black lacquer dial with silver subdials, this 40 mm stainless steel Daytona is powered by the automatic Rolex caliber 4130, offering 72 hours of power reserve and chronograph precision certified as a Superlative Chronometer. Complete with its full 2020 set, including box, warranty card, booklets, and accessories. A truly collector-grade example of the modern Daytona — unworn, stickered, and in factory condition.

model: Rolex Explorer II Polar white Dial
description: A beautiful example of the Rolex Explorer II “Polar”, featuring the bright white Luminova dial, confirmed as original on the accompanying papers. The watch has been recently polished and is presented in excellent overall condition, showing extremely light wear from use. The stainless steel bezel retains its original factory brushing, and the case remains sharp and clean. Fitted with the Oyster bracelet reference 78790A with solid endlinks, claspcode DE2, and showing very light stretch only. The movement has been serviced by our watchmaker and runs perfectly. Complete with its full 2001 set, including box, warranty papers, and booklets. A superb and crisp example of the classic Explorer II “Polar” — timeless, versatile, and ready to wear.
